creator: vseixas@iclass.com.br
text:
I had a fo file with no newlines or tabs, like this:
<fo:inline ...>blah blah </fo:inline><fo:inline ...>bleh bleh </fo:inline>
Resulting in a continuous sentence at the pdf file.

Then I edited the file and put some newlines between the tags, like this:
<fo:inline ...>blah blah </fo:inline>
<fo:inline ...>bleh bleh </fo:inline>
And the resulting sentence at the pdf file came with a line break between the 
blahs and the blehs...

Is this the correct behavior?

creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text:
If I put
<fo:inline >blah blah </fo:inline>
<fo:inline >bleh bleh </fo:inline>
into a block in a minimal FO file, then there is no line break.
Please supply a small self contained FO document demonstrating the problem.

creator: vseixas@iclass.com.br
text:
I figured out what was happening when I was preparing the file to post. My 
block tag is:
  <fo:block [...] white-space-collapse="false" [...]>
If I change it to true or remove it then fop ignores the tabs and newlines 
between the inlines...
batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
creator: gadams@apache.org
